transcript.text: [Music]
[Music]
[Music]
hi and welcome you listening to the x 22
report my name is dave and this is
episode 1262 a and today's date is april
twenty four twenty seventeen and the pot
of the episode is the election economic
surge has faded data shows something
horrific is headed our way let's get
into the economic collapse financial
news now we're going to head out to
greece and we can see that everything
that's been happening to greece well it
has not gone away whatsoever the
International Monetary Fund well they
had a message for Greece even if the
country secures debt relief from its
European creditors a question that is by
no means assured with bailout talks
still in deadlocked the nation still
needs even more painful economic
overhauls than currently planned really
this is a complete shock you mean the
people are have to give up more of
course they do remember the central bank
they don't want to bury a country where
they're in default because that looks
badly on the central bank because their
product is debt they need to keep them
in this limbo state now they're not
going to give up the debt they want the
country to sacrifice even more and
they're looking at pensions they're
looking at tax reforms they're looking
at many other fiscal and structural
reforms and we can see right now this is
what they do two countries now going
back to 2008 we can see nothing has
improved in Greece whatsoever even
though the corporate media was out there
continually telling us that things were
getting better and better as time went
on well they haven't nothing has really
changed they still have very very high
unemployment they're still in a huge
amount of debt they still need more and
more credit and they're still making the
people sacrifice so where's anything
better here there's nothing better
actually if they got rid of the central
bank and they write off the debt things
would improve dramatically look at
iceland they're improving this is why we
don't hear much about iceland what so
ever as you notice we only hear about
the nation's that are doing terribly and
the central bank and the corporate media
report on them but how they're getting
better when they're really not those
countries that got rid of the central
bank they never report on how well
they're doing now we see that wayfair
which is an online business for retail
for furniture well it looks like they're
in trouble right now now of course the
corporate media is out there saying is
because of Amazon launching their
furniture seller program but we see
right now that even as Amazon does this
we're going to see other online
businesses take a hit especially those
in retail because again if people don't
have funds to spend out in the brick or
mortar stores they're not going to have
funds to spend online and it will not
translate from brick-and-mortar to
online at this point because people are
still losing their jobs people don't
have discretionary funds and nothing has
been fixed at this point now we do see a
positive after 51 consecutive months the
caterpillar streak has ended they have a
one percent year-on-year positive growth
in sales now this is the first increase
since november of 2012 but then we need
to look at the reason why this happened
and it was China which saw a forty six
percent surge in total machine sales up
from thirty-nine percent last month but
when we look around at the rest of the
world latin america down twenty five
percent north america down thirteen
percent the Middle Eastern countries
down three percent it doesn't look good
and this looks like this is a one-off
thing coming out of China and we need to
understand that so far IBM caterpillar
many many other countries they are
reporting declining sales and they are
not getting better whatsoever now
looking at the breakdown of what kind of
machines drove the global rebound it was
all construction related machinery which
rose seven percent once
again entirely due to China now we've
been looking at the economy for quite a
while and we're realizing that things
are rapidly breaking down and we know
there's about eight thousand plus stores
that are going to be closing this year
and we know there's going to be millions
upon millions of retail space that is
going to be available and it looks like
it's going to increase to about 147
million square feet and this is a
commercial real estate bubble in the
making we know that the Atlanta Fed GDP
model is now projecting point five
percent growth restaurants are
experiencing their toughest stretch
since the last recession foot traffic at
chain restaurants in March drop
three-point-four percent from a year ago
menu prices couldn't be increased enough
to make up for it and same-store saw
sales fell by 1.1 percent in March us
factory output decline at the fastest
pace in more than two years according to
the BLS not a single person is employed
in nearly one out of every five us
families US government revenues just
suffered their biggest drop since the
last recession nearly all the big
automakers report reported disappointing
sales in March and dealer inventories
have now risen to the highest level that
we've seen since the last recession and
we know that use vehicle prices well
they're crashing right now at this point
most US consumers are completely tapped
out and six out of ten Americans well
they don't have enough money to save
even to cover a five-hundred-dollar
emergency costs just like in 2008 debts
are going bad at a very alarming pace in
fact things have already gotten so bad
that the IMF has issued a major warning
about it in America alone bad debt held
by companies could reach 4 trillion
dollars or almost a quarter of corporate
assets considered that debt could
undermine financial stability if
mishandled this is coming from the IMF
so when we look at all of this that's
been happening here we can see that the
economy has been deteriorating very very
quickly it is
not improved it is not getting better
and those country where the IMF to EU
and the corporate media has been telling
us that things are getting better it
looks like we're seeing an improvement
they haven't and we're looking at this
every couple of months and we can see
that nothing has improved whatsoever
it's only gotten worse and who has to
sacrifice every single time it is the
people now we know that the banks in
Europe they are in big trouble right now
and we know that the banks in Spain
they're having a huge amount of trouble
banco popular well looks like they're
going to have a huge problem coming up
very very soon because they must pull in
another capital expansion this time
around four billion euros last time they
pulled in around 5.4 billion and they
raised at three separate times with
their previous right issues and they are
burning through this like crazy now you
have to remember the bank's market cap
is just 2.9 billion euros and they're
going to need more funds very quickly
and Popular's long-term investors well
they're smarting up here some are even
threatening to sue popular for
intentionally misleading them in the
last year's right sale it's not just
investors are unhappy the bank's
depositors many of whom are voting with
their feet by moving their money
elsewhere they are very angry last year
the bank lost about six point five
percent of the of its deposits base and
it is growing right now and accelerating
now according to a report by the
financial daily elko financial the
deposit outflow is swelling from a
trickle into like a roaring rapids where
people are like just leaving the bank
and this is a huge problem we've seen
this in Greece we're seeing in Italy
we're seeing it in Spain and all these
banks they're going to need more funding
and it's getting more and more difficult
for them to survive and it's just going
to take one bay
to take a dive and this is going to
spread to other banks now Deutsche Bank
is out there and they're saying well it
was good while it lasted and remember we
reported on how the global credit
impulse had unexpectedly tumbled turning
negative and as we reported on this we
said as this happens the reflection of
the world's economy that's going to
start to slow credits can out get harder
to get and we are starting to see this I
mean look at the hard economic data that
we are seeing right now we are seeing
that things are rapidly turning the
other way everything that we saw prior
or during the election well that's all
gone right now the only thing that's
left is this stock market but all the
real economic data everything that's
going on around us it is falling apart
very very quickly which tells us that we
only have a certain amount of time left
and this means that as we move
throughout this year it the data is just
going to get worse it doesn't matter if
the stock market continually Rises when
there is more and more stores going out
of business when the GDP goes below zero
percent when corporate defaults are on
the rise and everything else starts
caving in and contracting imploding on
itself how are they going to explain
this away well we've got the stock
market that's all they have and it's not
going to fly anymore they understand
this and I say they the central bank's
the deep state they realize that this
was the time to start bringing down the
system this is why they started to raise
the rates right now and we're already at
a point where they're saying okay we
have about a sixty-nine percent chance
that the rates are going to be raised in
June most likely they will be I would be
surprised if they don't and if they do
raise the rates it's another signal that
they are preparing and getting ready to
bring this economy down because with
each raise of the interest rates it's
another notch of bringing down the
economy this is what we saw prior to two
thousand eight and as soon as they hit
that
point where things started to really
crumble and fall apart that's when they
started to lower the rates so you'll
know when that point hits so you have
two indicators here once we hit that
height of the interest rates and they
say okay we're going to start lowering a
little bit you know right there and then
they got the effect they needed when you
see gold moving up and these slams that
they continually put on gold and silver
they're not working anymore and gold
starts moving up fifty a hundred dollars
and they slam it down by like 25 then it
goes up another hundred that's another
indicator so we're going to see these
small little indicators coming out from
all different places to let us know that
the economy is rapidly deteriorating
they're bringing it down because we saw
these indicators going back to 2007
going into 2008 we saw them going back
to the dot-com bubble and we are
starting to see them now so we are
starting to see these indicators we're
starting to see the economy come down
the hard data that we're looking at
tells us that we are heading to
something horrific get prepared listen
everyone thanks a lot for listening be
well be safe and especially be prepared
thanks a lot
you
you
